title: (x) Acromedia fat modern italic - Thorowgood {Yves}
content:
I am redesigning a logo based on the font in this image. Anyone have an idea as to what font it is?

Thanks,

Adonya

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [acromedia.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820025817/http:/typophile.com/files/acromedia.jpg) | 48.67 KB |
author: Adonyao

comments.content: The angle of [Normande Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820025817/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=BT.107719.0.0&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Acromedia&sampleSize=48) is even closer, though some character shapes are still a bit off.

Then there's [Annlie Extra Bold Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820025817/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=EF.6440.0.2&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Acromedia&sampleSize=48), which has the inwards flexing stem endings.

Bingo! It's [Thorowgood Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820025817/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=EF.100690.0.2&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Acromedia&sampleSize=48). I think the fact that your sample might be pre-digital accounts for the difference in the lowercase _e_.
